channel.title: Concurrent ASM Updater Base
channel.description:
UPDATED AGAIN. Problems fixed.
Here's my concurrent ASM Updater base (no hooks... cba):

Feel free to use it and if there is anything wrong with it please post!!

item.title: Concurrent ASM Updater Base
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Rakura:

Wait, where is this code you’re talking about?

the general convention is:

if (condThatNeedsExecutionToStopOhGodISoundLikeRulerEric)
        //do not continue
//something complex

vs.

if (!condThatNeedsExecutionToStopOhGodISoundLikeRulerEric)
        //something complex
//throw an error (need an else) OR let execution terminate (do not need an else)

(you might not have it in your code, i dun no; just keep it in mind)

Rakura:

And do you mean InstructionFinder? (I don’t know of a InstructionSearcher)

Read full topic

item.title: Concurrent ASM Updater Base
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Looks alright.

It should include everything except for the RS specific update code. I suggest you start with porting InstructionSearcher from BCEL. It is very useful.

Nitpick:

for (Object o : array) { if(o != null) { //BIG ASS IF BLOCK } else throw new Error() or break; }
Would look much better like this:

for (Object o : array) { if(o == null) throw new Error() or break; //BIG ASS IF BLOCK }

Read full topic

item.title: Concurrent ASM Updater Base
item.dc:creator: @Rakura Rakura
item.description:
@Rakura wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:2, topic:335166”]There’s some @author’s missing credit in your post.

To everyone else, don’t look at this and expect much… It truly is just the updater portion, very limited. It has no tools or utilities for searching and identifying; However, it does lay some (sparing) framework for it.

That said, thanks for your open source point of view and posts, always encouraged <3.[/quote][quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:2, topic:335166”]There’s some @author’s missing credit in your post.

To everyone else, don’t look at this and expect much… It truly is just the updater portion, very limited. It has no tools or utilities for searching and identifying; However, it does lay some (sparing) framework for it.

That said, thanks for your open source point of view and posts, always encouraged <3.[/quote]

The only method I used that wasn’t mine was Kosaki’s download() method which I clearly said was done by him in the doc-comment above the method. If there was anything else that seemed familiar, then it was probably coincidence (how different can one get with injectAccessor or setSuperclass methods?).

Yeah, I totally agree that it doesn’t have any tools or utilities. I should probably write some :p. But regarding “sparing”, how much more robust does the framework itself need to be? Like, besides the utilities, what else does it need?

Read full topic

item.title: Concurrent ASM Updater Base
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

There’s some @author’s missing credit in your post.

To everyone else, don’t look at this and expect much… It truly is just the updater portion, very limited. It has no tools or utilities for searching and identifying; However, it does lay some (sparing) framework for it.

That said, thanks for your open source point of view and posts, always encouraged <3.

Read full topic
